page.title: 10Queen's Park Fire Brigade
page.content: Strathclyde Fire Station in Queen's Park was opened in 1896 to serve the growing built-up area around it. The station covers Pollokshields, Shawlands, Rutherglen, Cathcart, Govanhill and Crosshill and has two fire engines on call at all times. On average, the fire station receives eight calls a day but not all are emergencies. Some are domestic calls such as people being locked out of their homes. Unfortunately, the fire station is plagued by hoax calls. Access to and from the station is increasingly difficult due to traffic congestion. In a day, a fireman's duties include fire drill, maintenance of engines and equipment, physical training and lectures.Sometimes the station is visited by school parties and the firemen organise sponsored drives for charity.
